::: {.callout-note}
**Summary**  
Researcher in official statistics and labour economics, with experience in sampling and weighting, production of social statistics, methodological development, poverty and social inclusion indicators, international migration, and human capital formation. Active in national and EU projects, with teaching experience (R for official statistics) and involvement in organizing the *Use of R in Official Statistics (uRos)* international conference.
:::

## About {#about}

- Location: Bucharest, Romania  
- Areas: social statistics, sampling & weighting, sampling errors, poverty/social inclusion indicators, demography, international migration, labour economics, human capital, R & LaTeX, training.  
- Affiliations: National Institute of Statistics (INS); Institute for National Economy – Romanian Academy.

## Professional Experience {#experience}

<div class="section-card">

**Researcher**, *National Institute of Statistics (INS)* — Bucharest, Romania  
**Period:** 17 Oct 2011 – present  
**Unit:** Household surveys sampling unit (since 07 Feb 2013)  
**Key responsibilities:** sampling frame construction, survey design, weighting and error computation, organization of social surveys, methodological development for social inclusion, poverty and inclusion indicators, questionnaire design, participation in national/EU projects, organization of the *Use of R in Official Statistics (uRos)* conference (13 editions), technical trainings in R, activities for the 2021 Population and Housing Census.
</div>

<div class="section-card">

**Senior Researcher**, *Institute for National Economy, Romanian Academy* — Bucharest, Romania  
**Period:** 01 Mar 2014 – present  
**Topics:** labour market dynamics, productivity, human capital formation, demographic transitions, scientific publishing, participation in projects and conferences.
</div>

<div class="section-card">

**Lecturer (adjunct)**, *ASE – Department of Cybernetics, Statistics and Economic Informatics* — Bucharest, Romania  
**Period:** 01 Oct 2024 – 28 Feb 2025  
**Activities:** “European Statistical System” seminars with R applications for official statistics (EMOS master programme); exercises and case studies using Eurostat/INS data; R data import, processing and analysis; use of dedicated R packages.
</div>

<div class="section-card">

**Demography & Censuses expertise (earlier role)**, *INS – Demography and Censuses Directorate*  
**Period:** 17 Oct 2011 – 01 Jul 2013  
**Focus:** methodologies for international migration estimation based on SAE techniques (EU/UN regulations review, model testing); operations for the 2011 Census (final tables validation, derived indicators).
</div>
